author: jimmygchen
content:
> - Is there a way to simulate poor connection on these devnets/local testnets?
I'm not sure if Kurtosis supports this out of the box, maybe <@412614104222531604> knows? But given that we're using Docker, we could configure the `qdisc` to simulate network latency using `tc`. (https://medium.com/@kazushi/simulate-high-latency-network-using-docker-containerand-tc-commands-a3e503ea4307) 

> From this (although not conclusive), it seems that the network bandwidth between a super node and a full node is about 10x for a small network
Yep would be interesting to see a larger network though. Also this was tested under "perfect" network condition, which means there's little extra block lookup / range sync activity. I suspect there would be more rpc requests to supernodes on a bigger and more realistic network, which could make this gap even bigger.

author: jimmygchen
content:
> Do you know roughly what the reduction is here? ie 2x or 4x

Roughly I think a Deneb full node would consume half the bandwidth for blobs compared to PeerDAS supernode, so *based on this setup*, a deneb full node is estimated to consumex roughly 4-5x more bandwidth than a peerdas full node (with no validators attached)
